definition: to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
variant of 弄[long4]
old variant of 弄[nong4]

sentences.english: New growth is recurved , like a fiddle-neck.
sentences.chinese: 新的增长爆发，像摆弄颈部。

sentences.english: It is dangerous for children to play about with knife.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子摆弄刀是很危险的。

sentences.english: In Oates' works, females are always played with by violence.
sentences.chinese: 在欧茨笔下，女性始终处于暴力的包围与摆弄中。

sentences.english: He played nicknack on my sticks.
sentences.chinese: 在我的拐杖上摆弄他的小玩意儿。

sentences.english: Young Nina loved to play with the fabrics in her father’s workshop.
sentences.chinese: 尼娜小时候非常喜欢摆弄父亲缝纫店里的各种布料。

sentences.english: There sat her elderly friend, parked in a wheel chair, puttering with a row of posies.
sentences.chinese: 她的老朋友坐在轮椅上，正摆弄着一排花束。

sentences.english: Pamela fingered the pearl choker around her thin throat.
sentences.chinese: 帕米拉摆弄一下紧围在她细脖子上的珍珠项链。

sentences.english: He played nicknack on my knee.
sentences.chinese: 在我的膝盖上摆弄他的小玩意儿。

sentences.english: He played nicknack on my gate.
sentences.chinese: 在我的大门上摆弄他的小玩意儿。

sentences.english: Richard was fiddling with the Ford's radio.
sentences.chinese: 理查德在摆弄这辆福特车里的收音机。

sentences.english: He picked up a pencil and toyed with it idly.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一支铅笔，无所事事地摆弄着。

sentences.english: The son takes off his shoes and wiggles his toes in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 儿子脱了鞋，在草丛里摆弄脚趾头。

sentences.english: Careful how you handle that gun.
sentences.chinese: 你摆弄那支枪可要当心。

sentences.english: If you play with dangerous chemicals like that you're just asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你这样摆弄危险的化学品，那就是自讨苦吃。

sentences.english: Stop messing with the spoon and finish your breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 别摆弄匙子，快把早饭吃了。

sentences.english: Toying with a skirt, you seem to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 摆弄著衣襟，你好像在笑。

definition: to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to turn around in one's hands/to play with/to fiddle with
to play with/to finger
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
to tinker with/to incite
full details/full particulars
to look over carefully/to scrutinize
to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
to make a continual banging sound/(fig.) to provoke with words
to pick up
(coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand
to stroke/to caress
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
to look after/to tend (one's crops, garden, livestock, pets etc)/to repair
